info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 2:47PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact the Grand Canyon, including the South Rim, in Coconino County... At 246 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, or 15 miles west of Desert View at Grand Canyon, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Maricopa Point At Grand Canyon, Yaqui Point At Grand Canyon, Hermit`s Rest At Grand Canyon, Shoshone Point At Grand Canyon, Pima Point At Grand Canyon, Bright Angel Point, South Rim Visitors Center, Cape Royal At Grand Canyon, Hopi Point At Grand Canyon and Grand Canyon Village. This includes State Route 64 near mile marker 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
